intro: Enodium, commonly known as the cow-calf plant, is a flowering plant native to southern and eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Enodium is not typically cultivated for agricultural purposes but is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
